explanation: The report is correct. Both strncpy calls copy an extra byte (count = WS_KEY_LEN+1 and WS_GUID_LEN+1) so the terminating NUL characters from key and GUID are written into str, but the SHA1Input call uses an explicit length WS_KEY_GUID_LEN (WS_KEY_LEN + WS_GUID_LEN) and only consumes the exact concatenated bytes (no terminator). After hashing the buffer is freed and str is never used as a NUL-terminated string; the written NUL bytes are never read. Therefore the writes of those terminating NULs are operations whose removal would not change program behaviour and qualify as dead code under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. (A suitable remediation is to use memcpy for the fixed-width copies or to copy only WS_KEY_LEN and WS_GUID_LEN bytes.)
